directions: Add dry beans to a heavy bottomed pot and cover with water by 2 inches. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat, cover and let sit for 1 hour. Or soak beans overnight.
In a large pot over medium heat, add the olive oil, garlic, onion, carrots, celery, cook for 5 minutes.
Add the soaked beans, tomatoes, sugar, bay leaf, and stock to the pot. Cover and cook until beans are soft, about 20 minutes.
Remove the lid, add the kale and continue cooking for 5 minutes.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
I like to add a couple drops of hot sauce to my bowl before eating.
ingredients: 4 cups of tomatoes – peeled, seeded, and chopped (4 – 5 tomatoes)
4 cups of kale, rib removed and slice kale into 1″ribbons
title: Black-eyed Pea Soup {Lucky Bean Soup}
